title: Patrick Haggerty, ‘Lost Pioneer’ of Gay Country Music, Dies at 78
description: In 1973, he put out a little-noticed album of songs about same-sex love and social protest. Forty-one years later, he became an unlikely star.
dc:creator: Alex Traub
media:description: Patrick Haggerty at his home this year in Bremerton, Wash. The rediscovery of an album he recorded in 1973 brought him renown as the first openly gay country singer.
